column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.3
#T_SP=webanno.custom.DemoNERRE|NamedentityTags
#T_RL=webanno.custom.DemoRE|NamedentityRelations|BT_webanno.custom.DemoNERRE
#Text=Polycrystalline MgB2+xSiC (x = 0, 5wt% & 10wt%, nominally) samples were synthesized by solid-state reaction route.
#Text=The Mg powder is from Reidel-de-Haen, amorphous B powder is from Fluka (of assay 95-97%) and SiC nanopowder (n-SiC) is from Aldrich (<100 nm).

#Text=The stoichiometric amounts of ingredients were ground thoroughly, palletized using hydraulic press and put in a tubular furnace for 2.5 hours in argon atmosphere at two different temperatures of 700 °C, and 850 °C.
#Text=Finally the furnace is cooled in the same atmosphere of argon to room temperature.
#Text=XRD (X-ray diffraction) is done on Rigaku miniflex II powder x-ray diffractrometer using CuKα radiation.
#Text=The magnetization/magnetotransport measurements were carried out on Quantum Design Physical Property Measurement System (PPMS) system.
#Text=Critical current density (Jc) was determined from magnetization loop using the extended Bean model.
#Text=Fully characterized pallets are subsequently masterized to reduce them in powders for ex-situ powder-in-tube (PIT) process.
#Text=Monofilamentary MgB2, MgB2+5 wt% SiC and MgB2+10 wt% SiC tapes were fabricated following the ex-situ route of the conventional PIT method [18].
#Text=MgB2 powders (either pure or doped) were packed inside Ni tubes of 12.7 mm outer and 6mm inner diameter.
#Text=The tapes were groove rolled and drawn down to a diameter of 2 mm, then cold rolled in several steps to a tape of about 0.35 mm in thickness and 4 mm in width.
#Text=The superconducting transverse cross section of the conductor was about 0.5 mm2 .
#Text=The conductors were then subjected to a final heat treatment of sintering at 920 °C for 20 minutes in flowing argon atmosphere.

#Text=Transport critical current density measurements (Jct) were performed over 10 cm long samples at the Grenoble High Magnetic Field Laboratory at 4.2 K in magnetic field up to 13 T, applied both perpendicular and parallel to the tape surface, while the current was applied perpendicular to the magnetic field.
#Text=Short pieces of about 6 mm in length were employed for the magnetization measurements vs. magnetic field performed with a commercial 5.5 MPMS Quantum Design Squid magnetometer.
#Text=The magnetization measurements were performed at 5 K on part of conductors selected from the same batch of material used for the transport measurements.
#Text=Demagnetization corrections are negligible at fields above 0.7 T, which is the saturation field of Ni.
